title: Orders view
body: The Orders view shows the client’s trade orders. The user can view the list of orders in all portfolios or in a portfolio chosen in the drop-down at the top. If a portfolio has subportfolios, the Orders view shows orders from subportfolios as well. Orders can be filtered by transaction date, order type, and security.

title: Orders view
body: Orders in the list are grouped by status (Open, Accepted, In execution, Cancelled). For each order in the list, the user can view security name, portfolio name, transaction date, units, order type, and trade amount.

title: Canceling an order
body: The user can cancel an order in Open or Accepted status by clicking the icon. To make this option available for the user, add the portfolio to the portfolio group CP_CANCEL in FA Back.

title: Transaction details
body: The user can download the PDF transaction confirmation report by clicking the Download transaction confirmation button. If there is no transaction confirmation generated in FA Back, the document is generated on the fly. On-the-fly generation requires a custom JSReport transaction confirmation report installed. For details, see Transaction confirmation report (PDF) .

title: Trading view
body: The Trading view allows users to browse securities on the markets and create buy trade orders. Securities in the list are grouped by security type. The user can filter securities by Country and Security type and search by Security name.

title: Trading view
body: To provide access to the Trading view, add the user's portfolio in the CP_TRADING portfolio group in FA Back (for details about portfolio groups, see Portfolio groups in FA Back reference).

title: Trading view
body: Trade orders are imported to FA Back and can be further processed there and sent to a marketplace.

title: Security details
body: Security details show security information and display recent price change as a graph. The user can view:

title: Security details
body: Security information (security type, ISIN code, currency).

title: Security details
body: Performance over time (one, three, and five years) in percentage (also on a graph).

title: Security details
body: Buy and/or Sell buttons. To enable buying and selling options for a security, you need to add a "Tradeable" tag to this security in FA Back.

title: Security details
body: Documents (prospectus and KIID). To make the documents available to the user, navigate to the Security window in FA Back and input the prospectus and KIID URLs in the URL and URL 2 fields. Make sure the URLs begin with a valid protocol (http://, https:// or ftp://) or they will not be visible to the user in the FA Client Portal.

title: Buying a security

title: Buying a security
body: By default, all security types except for collective investment vehicles are traded in units. Collective investment vehicles are traded in trade amount. To change this, go to the Security window in FA Back and choose one or more options in the Trade type field: "Buy units", "Buy trade amount", "Sell units", "Sell trade amount".

title: Buying a security
body: Trading options (buying and selling) are also available in the Holdings view.

title: Holdings view
body: The Holdings view shows the client’s investments and lets the user buy and sell securities. The user can view the list of securities in all portfolios or in a portfolio chosen in the drop-down at the top. If a portfolio has subportfolios, the Holdings view shows values aggregated from subportfolios.

title: Holdings view
body: Holdings in the list are grouped by security type. For each holding in the list, the user can view its ISIN code, number of units, purchase value, total market value and unrealized profit since start.

To change this, go to the Security window in FA Back and choose one or more options in the Trade type field: "Buy units", "Buy trade amount", "Sell units", "Sell trade amount".

title: Documents view
body: The Documents view shows the documents stored on the client's contact, portfolios and subporfolios in FA Back.

title: Related links

title: Data modifications view
body: The Data modifications view covers all applications that modify the core data of the platform (contacts, portfolios, customers, transactions, trade orders, and so on). The first section concerns the performance statistics of rule runs. The second section concerns data operation metrics.

title: Rules and decision tables
body: The charts in the Rules and decision tables section only include cases where rule conditions were met and consequences were executed. The charts describe the execution times of the consequences.

title: Rules and decision tables
body: Indicative total execution time per rule

title: Rules and decision tables
body: The total execution time (in milliseconds) per rule run during the selected time period. If multiple rules or decision tables are triggered simultaneously for the same object, the total time spent on those rules is counted towards each individual rule run. For example, triggering five rules with 10 millisecond execution times for one object (contact, portfolio, security, transaction, or trade order) will result in a total execution time of 50 milliseconds for each rule.

title: Rules and decision tables
body: Number of rule triggers

title: Rules and decision tables
body: The number of times a rule was triggered during the selected time period. This includes rules from decision tables and other types of rules, for example, rules generated with scripts.

title: Rules and decision tables
body: Indicative average execution time per rule

title: Rules and decision tables
body: The average execution time (in milliseconds) per rule run during the selected time period. Long average execution times may indicate performance problems. If multiple rules or decision tables are triggered simultaneously for the same object (contact, portfolio, security, transaction, or trade order), the total time spent on those rules is counted towards each individual rule run. For example, five simultaneously triggered rules with 10 millisecond execution times will have average execution times of 50 milliseconds.

title: Rules and decision tables
body: Triggered rules per minute

title: Rules and decision tables
body: The time at which each rule was triggered, accurate to the minute. The chart shows a more detailed analysis of the number of rule triggers and lets you analyse their distribution over the selected time period.

title: Rules and decision tables
body: When you view Triggered rules per minute, you might need to zoom in on the chart to see the values clearly, especially in the case of large time scales.

title: Data modifications
body: Except for the Database latency, all charts show the values split by:

title: Data modifications
body: Data type (portfolio, transaction, trade order, and so on).

title: Data modifications
body: Operation type (create/update/delete portfolio, security, and so on). One data operation means an addition/modification/deletion of a single data row in FA. For example, creating a new transaction in FA results in two operations: a transaction creation operation, and a separate transactionVO creation operation.

title: Data modifications
body: As the chart lines are quite narrow, values might not show up until you zoom in a bit, especially on a bigger scale.

title: Data modifications
body: Average data change latency per data type

title: Data modifications
body: The average time (in milliseconds) per data operation, broken down by data type. Spikes on this chart may indicate a (temporary) performance bottleneck.

title: Data modifications
body: Average data change latency per data type and operation type

title: Data modifications
body: Same as above, broken down by data type and operation type.

title: Data modifications
body: Time spent on data operations

title: Data modifications
body: Total amount of time spent on various data operations during a given time window (1-2 minutes), broken down per data type. Spikes on this chart indicate that extensive data modification took place at a given point in time; it does not automatically indicate slowness.

title: Data modifications
body: Time spent on data operations per operation type

title: Data modifications
body: Same as above, broken down by data type.

title: Data modifications
body: Data changes per minute

title: Data modifications
body: The number of objects created/modified/deleted during a given 1-minute time window. Due to technical reasons, the numbers might not be fully accurate, especially with smaller modification counts, but close to it. Spikes on this chart are not directly indicative of the performance, they indicate extensive data modification taking place.

title: Data modifications
body: Data changes per minute per operation type

title: Data modifications
body: Same as above, broken down by operation type.

title: Data modifications
body: Database latency

title: Data modifications
body: The database response time. The values on the chart should normally stay under 1 millisecond. Values that permanently exceed this limit indicate a potential problem in the technical setup. Spikes in these values may indicate performance problems.

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: # Code Required Name Description

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: 1 po.extId No No. External ID of the posting. Used when updating an existing posting. If left empty, the system generates a running number as an ID.

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: 2 po.status Yes Status Posting status: ReadyNot finishedDeletedReported

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: 3 po.parentPortfolio Yes Portfolio ID Text or number uniquely identifying a portfolio.

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: 4 po.postingDate Yes Posting date Date formatted as yyyy-MM-dd.

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: 5 po.effectiveDate No Effective date Date formatted as yyyy-MM-dd.

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: 6 po.accountNumber Yes Account number Bookkeeping account number.

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: 7 po.accountSetName Yes Account set Account set name.

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: 8 po.amount Yes Amount Posting amount: positive number for credit, negative for debit.

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: 9 po.reference No Posting reference. Free text, allowing you to fill in additional details on your postings.

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: 10 po.memo No Memo Posting memo. Free text, allowing you to fill in additional details on your postings.

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: 11 po.transactionExtId No External ID External ID of the linked transaction. If you provide this ID, the bank account number and security code are fetched from the transaction (do not fill them in).

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: 12 po.bankAccountNumber No Bank account no. The number of a bank account linked to the portfolio.

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: 13 po.securityCode No Security code The code of the security this posting is related to.

title: Schedules tab
body: Convention Description

title: Schedules tab
body: Following Move to the next valid business day.

title: Schedules tab
body: Modified following (without crossing mid-month or month end) Move to the next valid business day, unless that is after the 15th of the month OR in the next month in which case move to the previous valid business day.

title: Schedules tab
body: Modified following (without crossing month end) Move to the next valid business day, unless that is in the next month in which case move to the previous valid business day.

title: Schedules tab
body: Modified preceding (without crossing month start) Move to the previous valid business day, unless that is in the previous month in which case move to the next valid business day.

title: Schedules tab
body: Nearest For Sunday and Monday, move to the next valid business day, for all other days, move to the previous valid business day.

title: Schedules tab
body: No adjustment Make no adjustment.

title: Schedules tab
body: Preceeding Move to the previous valid business day.
